snippet: President Obama laid out his re-election bid as a stark choice between strong government action to lift the middle class and Republican policies he said had led to a deep recession.
abstract: Pres Obama, speaking to voters in Cleveland, frames his re-election bid as a stark choice between government action to lift the middle class and a return to the Republican economic policies that he says caused the recession; Mitt Romney addresses voters in Cincinnati on the same day, attempting to overshadow Obama's speech by attacking his management of the economy.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and MICHAEL BARBARO
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Cleveland, and Michael Barbaro from Cincinnati.

lead_paragraph: President Obama laid out his re-election bid as a stark choice between strong government action to lift the middle class and Republican policies he said had led to a deep recession.

headline.main: Obama Says Election Offers a Clear Choice on the Economy’s Long-Term Path
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Election Offers a Clear Choice on the Economy’s Long-Term Path
